availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Quincy Adams King (Representative from Paducah)

body.p: Born on May 28, 1828 in Burksville. Attorney. Elected to both houses of Kentucky General Assembly while living in Paducah. Served as Speaker of the state House of Representatives in the 1850s. He became acting lieutenant governor in 1858 when James G. Hardy, the incumbent under Governor Charles Morehead, died. King married Leann Sophia King (1833-1910). He died at his home in Denver, Colorado, in 1880.

bibl.p: "John Quincy Adams King Papers, 1847-1874." John Quincy Adams King Papers, 1847-1874. Accessed February 06, 2017. https://nyx.uky.edu/fa/findingaid/?id=xt7cc24qk37s.
